item.description:
Ryan Gosling, one of our most talented and treasured indpendent film actors from Lars and The Real Girl and Blue Valentine, stars in Drive, what looks like a not-to-be-mi   ssed thriller heist.  He doesn't carry the film alone.  See the promotional blurb below for an amazing ensemble cast. The film has received a 95% Fresh rating from all critics of Rotten Tomatoes and a 91% Fresh rating from top critics.

We'll meet at 5:45 pm at Zaftig's for a deli supper and aim to be at The Coolidge by 7:15.  Betsey will have a red card stock Meetup sign visible at both places. 

Purchase your tickets in advance if possible.  This will be a popular film, though Sunday evenings don't usually sell out, there is always a first time.

 

Please be sure to be responsible for your commitment to join us.  If your plans change, change your RSVP accordingly.

From the Coolidge Corner website:

Breakout Danish direcor Nicolas Winding Refn (The Pusher Trilogy, Bronson, Valhalla Rising) throttles into the Hollywood fast lane with the precision-crafted action caper Drive: Cannes Film Festival sensation and this fall's hottest film. Starring Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan, Bryan Cranston, Christina Hendricks, Ron Perlman, with Oscar Isaac, and Albert Brooks.

Ryan Gosling stars as a Los Angeles wheelman for hire, known only as "Driver", stunt driving for movie productions by day and steering getaway vehicles for armed heists by night. Though a loner by nature, Driver can’t help falling in love with his beautiful neighbor Irene (Carey Mulligan), a vulnerable young mother dragged into a dangerous underworld by the return of her ex-convict husband Standard (Oscar Isaac).

After a heist intended to pay off Standard's protection money spins unpredictably out of control, Driver finds himself driving defense for the girl he loves, tailgated by a syndicate of deadly serious criminals (Albert Brooks and Ron Perlman). But when he realizes that the gangsters are after more than the bag of cash in his trunk—that they're coming straight for Irene and her son—Driver is forced to shift gears and go on offense.

290 Harvard Street, Brookline MA 02446//Recording 617–734–2500//
item.how_to_find_us: 5:45 pm Zaftig's, 335 Harvard Ave, Brookline 02446 - 7:15 Coolidge Corner Theater Betsey has a black pocketbook and red stock Meetup sign
item.name: Drive 7:15 pm The Coolidge 5:45 Zaftig's
